p: In industrial production processes, the hardness and strength values of supermartensitic stainless steel are of the utmost importance. The mechanical properties are usually controlled by chemical composition and thermo-mechanical treatments [ 9, 10, 11, 12, 13, 14, 15]. Nevertheless, they are often observed with various factors of the final mechanical properties. The mechanical properties are strongly dependent on the fraction of reverted austenite [ 16, 17, 18, 19, 20], which is very sensitive to the heat treatment. Minor changes in heat treatment parameters will result in significant changes in the mechanical properties. The heat treatments of supermartensitic stainless steel are achieved by quenching and tempering after hot working [ 21].
